62.title:  Granacher, René, 1966- "Heinz Schubel"
62.author: von René Granacher
notes: Begins: "Die Hefte mit den Abenteuern des Feursalamanders Lurchi waren seit ihrem ersten Erscheinen in den 1930er Jahren nich nur ein wichtiges Werbeinstrument, sonder auch ein prägendes Stück Unterhaltungsliteratur für Kinder. Das ist vor allem dem Zeichner Heins Schubel zu verdanken: Er formte das Bild der Hefte und Lurchis für mehrere Jahrzehnte."
Includes illustrations and bibliographical references.

63.title:  Granacher, René, 1966-
63.author: [No author]
notes: Miscellanea. "Die Autoren/Bildnachweis" p. 144 in Deutsche Comicforschung, Bd. 1 (2005).

A paragraph each about comics scholars Günter Dammann (1941-), Bernd Dolle-Weinkauff (1952-), René Granacher (1966-), Heiner Jahncke (1953-), Andreas Krägermann (1963-), Gerd Lettkemann (1950-), Eckart Sackmann (1951-), and Michael F. Scholz (1958-).

64.series: 2002) "Spanish Comics Convention Scandalized by Live Sex Performance"
64.appears_in: p. 15-17 in The Comics Journal, no. 243 (May 2002).
notes: (Newswatch)
About the 7th annual Granada Comics Festival (March 2002), where the awards were given out in a mock-terrorist attack. Peter Bagge and Lorna Miller are quoted. Includes photographs.

91.title:  Grand Ry, Michel de. Le Livre d'Or de la Bande Dessinée
91.author: textes de Michel de Grand Ry, André Nizette et Jean-Louis Lechat.

publication info.publisher: Une Edition du Centre de la Bande Dessinée Belge

notes: Summary: Short biographies and full-page color samples of the work of 30 comics professionals who entered the field between 1925 and 1955: Hergé, Jijé, Sirius, Tillieux, Funcken (Fred et Liliane), Laudy, E.P. Jacobs, Vandersteen, Reding, Cuvelier, Franquin, Martin, Marc Sleen, Hubinon, Morris, Paape, Peyo, Will, Attanasio, De Moor, Tibet, Weinberg, Bara, Craenhals, Graton, Macherot, Aidans, Greg, Roba, Jef Nys.
Subjects: Belgian comics, European comics, biography.

98.title:  Grand Avenue

notes: Summary: Grandma pretends she didn't see the kids coming.

99.title:  Grand Avenue
99.author: Breen.
notes: Summary: The kids are bored, but they disappear before Grandma can get to them with the photo albums.

100.title:  Grand Avenue
100.author: Breen.
100.series: Mar. 28, 2000) "My Friend, Candice, has a Dog who Laps Water Right out of the Toilet!"*

101.title:  Grand Avenue
101.author: Breen.
101.series: June 19, 2000) "Quick, Give Me Something to Do"
notes: Summary: Gabby's routine, structure and direction are gone, and she's having a difficult adjustment.

102.title:  Grand Avenue
102.author: Breen.
102.series: Oct. 13, 2000) "Your New Nickname on the Playground is 'Mondale'"*
notes: Summary: Gabby lost the hall monitor election badly.

103.title:  Grand Avenue
103.author: Breen.
notes: Summary: Rudy got bugs in Gabby's guacamole.

104.title:  Grand Avenue
104.author: Breen.
notes: Summary: Non-alcoholic beer is like decaffeinated coffee, or fat-free brownies, or...

105.title:  Grand Avenue
105.author: Breen.
105.series: Nov. 4, 2000) "I Can't Stand this Filth Any Longer!"*
notes: Gabby uses glass cleaner on the television screen.

106.title:  Grand Avenue
106.author: Breen.
106.series: Nov. 6, 2000) "We're Going to Take Rudy to the V-E-T"*
notes: Summary: Michael says "vet" and Rudy drags Gabby up a tree.

107.title:  Grand Avenue
107.author: Breen.
notes: Grandma (Kate) is warming her feet on Rudy's belly, and Gabby is concerned for Rudy (the dog).

108.title:  Grand Avenue
108.author: Breen.
108.series: Dec. 1, 2000) "Nothing Says Christmastime Like Eating a Piece of Grandma's Fruitcake"*
notes: Summary: The piece of fruitcake ends up in the fireplace.

109.title:  Grand Avenue
109.author: Breen.
109.series: Dec. 11, 2000 "That's Enough Christmas Card Writing for Tonight"*
notes: Summary: Kate's handwriting is illegible by card #150.

110.title:  Grand Avenue
110.author: Breen.
110.series: May 12, 2001) "I Wish I Had His Easy Life"*
notes: Summary: Kate pauses in her lawnmowing to look at Michael sitting under a tree, and Michael looks at the dog, and the dog looks at a squirrel, and the squirrel looks at a bug. All but the bug share the same thought balloon.

111.title:  Grand Avenue
111.author: Breen.
111.series: July 23, 2001) "All of a Sudden, a Tornado Picks Up Tara and Drops it on Top of Scarlett"*
notes: Summary: A dream combines Gone with the Wind and The Wizard of Oz.

112.title:  Grand Avenue
112.author: Breen.
112.series: Sept. 24, 2001) "A Flaming Skull with a Snake Around It"*
notes: Summary: Kate explains a bandage by saying she's gotten a tattoo, because that sounds more interesting than saying she gave blood.

113.title:  Grand Avenue
113.author: Breen.
113.series: June 3, 2002) "Rudy? What Kind of Goofy Name is That?"*
notes: Summary: They could have named the dog Rex, Rover, Rawhide, or Ralph.

114.title:  Grand Avenue
114.author: Breen.
notes: Summary: Mr. D., the teacher, will be working in his father's diner, but if you call it the Love Boat, call his spatula a margarita, and call Perth Amboy the tropics, it'll be a good summer.

115.title:  Grand Avenue
115.author: Breen.
115.series: June 13, 2002) "Rudy, What's the Pot Roast Taste Like?"*
notes: Summary: Rudy answers: "Bark."

116.title:  Grand Avenue
116.author: Breen.
notes: Summary: Gabby objects to the sexism of being asked to do housework, and is sent out to mow the lawn.

117.title:  Grand Avenue
117.author: Breen.
117.series: July 26, 2003) "I'll Do the Other Half Tomorrow"*
notes: Summary: Michael has mowed half the lawn, leaving strips of tall grass.

118.title:  Grand Avenue
118.author: Breen.
118.series: July 27, 2002) "I Guess She'd Rather the Carcinogens Get Us than the E. Coli"*
notes: Summary: Grandma is grilling hamburgers, well done.

119.title:  Grand Avenue
119.author: [No author]
119.series: July 3, 2004) "I Processed Your Cover Letter and Resumé in My Cuisinart!"*
notes: Summary: Gabby's letter to Martha Stewart asking for an internship gets a response.

120.title:  Grand Avenue
120.author: Breen.
120.series: July 5, 2004) "Leroy, Go Fetch that Tennis Ball"*
notes: Summary: Rudy the dog has a summer intern.

121.title:  Grand Avenue
121.author: Breen.
121.series: July 6, 2004) "He Even Kisses Up to the Boss!"*
notes: Summary: The intern is working out and may get a bigger cubicle.

122.title:  Grand Avenue
122.author: by Steve Breen.
notes: Summary: Grandma has her reason to look forward to school starting again.

123.title:  Grand Avenue
123.author: by Steve Breen and Mike Thompson.
123.series: Sept. 25, 2009) "You Can Put On Your Birthday Hats and Pass Out Your Birthday Cupcakes"*
notes: Summary: Gabby and Michael are not used to positive special attention.

124.title:  Grand Avenue
124.author: Steve Breen.
124.series: May 28, 2020) "Whatever Teachers Are Paid, It Isn't Enough"*
notes: (Grand Avenue Life in Quarantine)
Summary: The kids are antsy, doing school work at home.

125.title:  Grand Avenue
125.author: Steve Breen.
125.series: May 29, 2020) "We're Out of Paper Towels Again, Aren't We?"
notes: (Grand Avenue Life in Quarantine)
Summary: Gabby wants to hug Kate, and pat her on the back.

126.title:  Grand Avenue
126.author: Steve Breen.
notes: (Grand Avenue Life in Quarantine)
Summary: The kids are watching TV.

127.title:  Grand Avenue
127.author: by Steve Breen and Mike Thompson.
127.series: July 25, 2020) "And I Thought There Was No Upside to Quarantine"*
notes: Summary: Grandma Kate is apparently more easily able to get the kids to use their indoor voices.

128.title:  Grand Avenue
128.author: Steve Breen.
128.series: July 31, 2020) "It's 2020. What's 'Supposed to Be' Got To Do With Anything?"*
notes: Summary: Michael talks about the hot weather, and Gabby says it's Summer, it's supposed to be hot.

129.title:  Grand Avenue
129.author: by Steve Breen and Mike Thompson.
129.series: Aug. 6, 2020) "Variety is the Spice of Life"*
notes: Summary: Nothing to do, so this time they start their walk going north insted of south.

130.title:  Grand Avenue
130.author: by Steve Breen and Mike Thompson.
130.series: Aug. 15, 2020) "Like We Need a Reason to Hate Coronavirus"*
notes: Summary: The kids compliment Kate on having her hair done, and the hairdresser is closed for quarantine, and they don't get popsicles.

131.title:  Grand Avenue
131.author: Steve Breen.
notes: Summary: The kids hate doing school at home.

132.title:  Grand Avenue
132.author: by Steve Breen and Mike Thompson.
132.series: Mar. 1, 2021) "Good Gravy! What Was I Thinking"*
notes: Summary: The kids are back school in person, so Kate can't hear what they're telling their teacher.

133.title:  Grand Avenue
133.author: by Steve Breen and Mike Thompson.
133.series: Apr. 3, 2021) "I Can Remember When the Weekend Meant a Break From My Normal Routine"*
notes: Summary: Kate is doing housework in the covid era.

134.title:  Grand Avenue
134.author: by Steve Breen and Mike Thompson.
134.series: May 22, 2021) "I'll Have to Miss Dinner for the Good of the Community"*
notes: Summary: Michael's planning to keep his mask on all day (possibly because of an upcoming broccoli casserole).

137.title:  Grand Avenue Life in Quarantine
137.author: Steve Breen.

158.title:  "Le Grand Combat" p. 34-50 in Sous le Ciel de l'Ouest
158.author: textes et dessins de Morris, in Lucky Luke : Spécial 2 (Marcinelle-Charleroi, Belgique : Dupuis, 1980).
notes: Summary: Lucky Luke comes across a fellow who can't read, but who can knock out a charging bull with one punch, and who carries his horse when the horse needs a rest. The man's name is Percival Belden. Lucky Luke offers to be his manager and set up a boxing match with Killer Kelly, as Kelly is offering a $10,000 prize to anyone who can beat him. Percival agrees because he'd like to have enough money to marry Rosita, and so "Battling Belden the Butcher" is born. After a full set of gags about boxing and betting, the fight is about to begin when Rosita is kidnapped. A note says that if Belden wins the fight he'll never see Rosita again. Belden gets in the ring and starts letting himself be knocked down, while Lucky Luke rides out in search of Rosita, returning just in time to allow Belden to win the match with one punch.
